> public void testaMethod()
> {
> int a[] = new int[10];
> int b[] = new int[10];
Initializing variables leads to more predictable behavior.
Putting different values in the arrays leads to more interesting tests.

> for(int i =0; i< 10; i++)
> {
>     try
>     {
>         assertTrue(obj.aMethod(a[i], b[i])
Where does obj come from? 
Are the preconditions for the method under test fulfilled?

>     }
>     catch(Exception e)
>     {}
Why do you swallow the exception?

> }

What does happen and what did you expect to happen?
